resources.string: Are you sure you want to exit game?
Are you sure you want to reset high scores?
Are you sure you want to restart game?
Are you sure you want to exit to main menu?
Try to break all bricks on every level to get scores as high as you can and advance to the next level.

Slide the paddle(s) left and right to bounce back the ball(s). Each level is cleared by breaking all breakable bricks on the screen. The player can control the ball\'s angle with the paddle(s). The ball(s) will bounce off at the same angle and in the opposite direction after it hits a brick.
The player starts the game with 3 lives. The game ends when the ball touches the bottom (and the top on some levels) of the screen when the player has no more lives left.
There are four different type of bricks in the game.
These type of bricks can be normal or hard. Hard bricks are usually have darker colors than the normal ones and needs to be hit twice to break.
These type of bricks cannot be broken.
Increases the length of the paddle(s).
Decreases the length of the paddle(s).
Increases the speed of the ball(s) by 25%.
Decreases the speed of the ball(s) by 25%.
Transforms all balls on the field to fireballs. Fireballs break through every brick (except unbreakables).
Grants the paddle(s) the ability to catch the ball(s) and release them when necessary.
Grants random amount of scores from these values: 20, 50, 75, 100, 150, 200, 250, 500, 800, 1000, 2000.
Creates a shield on the paddle(s) for 15 seconds. The shield prevents the ball(s) from falling down.
Clones all balls on the field (maximum 8).
Graphics by: Ádám Szörényi & Attila Lelkó
There are %1$d different Power-Ups in the game.
Decreases the paddle(s) length to the minimum.
Bricks will fall down every time when a ball hits a paddle or a shield.
The paddle(s) will shoot lasers for 8 seconds. Lasers are destroying bricks (except unbreakables).

The values are for the normal game speed. The slow speed gives the 75%, the fast speed gives the 125% of the given values. Breaking a normal brick gives 100 points. Breaking a hard brick gives 120 (20 + 100) points. When a fireball goes through a brick, the player gets 75 points. Every level completion gives 2500 points.
The balls will lose their energy for 12 seconds. During that time they cannot break bricks.
The paddle(s) will lose control of the ball(s) for 12 seconds. During that time the ball(s) will always bounce back at the same angle and in the opposite direction from the paddle(s).
Resets all Power-Ups (except the number of the balls on the field).

In this game mode the balls change their color in every 15 seconds between red and yellow. In order to break a brick the red ball has to hit the red brick and the yellow ball has to hit the yellow brick. Orange bricks can be broken by both balls.
In Time Trial and Extreme Modes the player gets 8 points for every remaining seconds when a level is completed.
In Time Trial Mode there is a time limit on each level. When the time is up, the game ends. The time limit is 8 minutes for normal, 10 for slow and 6 for fast speed.
Extreme Mode is a combination of Color Mode and Time Trial Mode. The time limit in Extreme Mode is 10 minutes for normal, 12 for slow and 8 for fast speed.
This Power-Up only appears in Time Trial and Extreme Modes. It increases the remaining time on the current level by 60 seconds for normal, 80 for slow and 40 for fast speed.
Would you like to restore your data?\n\nThis will overwrite your current High Scores and Level Completion data!
